abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rapid Response
            Rehabilitation of Rural Livelihoods Project is to address
            the food crisis in Somalia by removing the production
            constraints and improve food security, rural incomes, and
            community assets. Negative impacts include: terrestrial
            habitat alteration; aquatic habitat disruption; soil
            degradation; land acquisition/ private assets displacement;
            use of inorganic fertilizers; construction nuisance; and
            increase in solid wastes. Mitigation measures include: 1)
            sites to avoid critical habitat through use of existing
            utility and transport corridors, whenever possible; 2)
            re-vegetation of disturbed areas with native plant species;
            3) sites to avoid critical aquatic habitat such as
            watercourses, wetlands, and riparian areas, whenever
            possible; 4) minimizing clearing and disruption to riparian
            vegetation; 5) assess soil characteristics and either avoid
            or provide drainage for areas prone to water logging; 6)
            provide appropriate technologies for integrated soil
            fertility management; 7) ensure road development is
            coordinated with local land use plans and discuss with
            existing governance structures; 8) aappropriate quality and
            quantity use of fertilizers according to soil capacity; and
            9) provide for proper waste disposal, and water supply and
            sanitation facilities.
